beans
Class PageManagerBean

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--beans.PageManagerBean
public class PageManagerBean
extends java.lang.Object

PageManagerBean is used to divide the multi-line page into serveral pages. Because all the data will stored in the bean ,so the scope of bean must be set as "session". You can use the bean simply follow the setps: 1.invoke method dumpIn() to save the data from database. 2.invoke method setPageLength() to set the page lines as you need(this step is optional). 3.invoke method getPage() to retrieve the specified page content from bean. The data from PageManagerBean is the same as you store in ,except less rows.

Method Detail

setPageLength

public void setPageLength(int leng)
set the row numbers per page. There is a default value.This method may not invoke at most time. "leng" should be greater than 0, otherwise the pageLength will not change. You can invoke the method getPageLength() to check the length value.
Parameters:
leng - int valule of page rows
Returns:
void
Throws:
no - exception thrown

public java.lang.String[][] dumpOut()

Returns:

getTotalPage

public int getTotalPage()
get how many pages there are. Notice that the return value is the total pages, and page number is begin with 0 ,so the max page number should be retrieve as following codes: eg. int totalPage = p.getTotalPage();//get the total pages ; int maxPageNum = totalPage - 1; // get the max page number;
Parameters:
none -  
Returns:
int total number of pages
Throws:
noException - no exception thrown

getPage

public java.lang.String[][] getPage(int pageNo)
get the specified page's content. pageNo is the page number which begins with 0. when this method is invoked , it will try to find the data meet the condition. If failed a null will be returned.
Parameters:
pageNo - int value of page no(start from 0)
Returns:
String[][] a table of this page(first line is the column name)
Throws:
noException - no exception thrown
